17:48 <cdop> hi there! what is the name for this box with navigation for site-internal navitgation (p.e. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Contents on the right side this box with title "Contents")?  
17:48 <cdop> does xwiki have this functionality?  
18:17 <cdop> Ok, there is a macro called "Table of contents"  
18:17 <cdop> But I would like to have its result in a side-menu... possible? :)  
18:22 <vmassol> cdop: sure  
18:26 <vmassol> cdop: trying it locally  
18:27 <cdop> i googled for "xwiki table of contents sidebar" but didnt find anything  
18:28 <vmassol> we have panels  
18:28 <vmassol> now it seems it's not so obvious to get teh toc macro to work in a panel for the main doc content, I'm trying to find a solution  
18:28 <vmassol> cdop: or are you talking about this:  
18:29 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing  
18:29 <vmassol> (the TOC on the right)  
18:30 <vmassol> ?  
18:30 <vmassol> if so all you need is a box macro around the toc macro: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing?viewer=code  
18:31 <cdop> yes, but i would like to have it in the sidebar... or automatically generated. on my wiki real dumb word-users will add and edit pages...  
18:31 <vmassol> I see, goodp oint  
18:32 <vmassol> interesting question :)  
18:33 <vmassol> of course one solution is to modify the correct vm  
18:34 <vmassol> contentview.vm  
18:34 <vmassol> but that's not easy  
18:35 <vmassol> especially since you cannot call a macro from a vm….  
18:35 <vmassol> I guess the simplest is to add a Skin Extension  
18:36 <vmassol> but not very easy either  
18:36 <cdop> maybe i can use templates? which always include the TOC-Macro?  
18:36 <cdop> (I wont allow Source.Editing)  
18:36 <cdop> (Only wysiwyg)  
18:36 <vmassol> I need to think a bit more  
18:36 <vmassol> template would work but it's cumbersome for this use case  
18:37 <vmassol> since as you say when you edit  
18:37 <vmassol> the user will be able to remove it  
18:37 <cdop> even in the wysiwyg?  
18:37 <vmassol> sure  
18:38 <cdop> ok, then an extension is the way to go...  
18:38 <cdop> cant be to hard to add a new menu-bar?  
18:40 <cdop> well well....  
18:44 <vmassol> cdop: I think you should create a jira issue for this  
18:44 <vmassol> we could easily improve the TOC macro to support this use case  
18:44 <vmassol> and then use it in a panel

18:54 <vmassol> mflorea: i think cdop could write a new toc macro and inside this macro get the transformation content and change the current block and xdom in there ;)  
18:54 <vmassol> s/content/context  
18:54 <cdop> erm, right  
18:55 <vmassol> a new wiki macro I mean  
18:55 <vmassol> it's probably 3-4 lines of scripts  
18:55 <vmassol> then you can use this new macro in a panel  
18:55 <vmassol> let me try it locally  
18:55 <+mflorea> vmassol: hmm, changing the context doc requires PR and by default panels don't have PR  
18:56 <vmassol> it's not about changing the context doc  
18:56 <+mflorea> PR are dropped just before rendering the panels  
18:56 <vmassol> it's the xdom in the Transformation context  
18:56 <+mflorea> ah  
18:56 <vmassol> but that will require groovy for sure  
18:56 <vmassol> and that requires PR  
18:56 <vmassol> ;)  
18:56 <vmassol> ah no  
18:56 <vmassol> it's ok  
18:56 <vmassol> it's in the macro  
18:56 <vmassol> not in the panel  
18:57 <+mflorea> but the macro will require PR  
18:58 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
19:01 <vmassol> something like:  
19:01 <vmassol> {{groovy}}  
19:01 <vmassol> def txcontext = xcontext.macro.context  
19:01 <vmassol> def xdom = xwiki.getDocument("Sandbox.WebHome").getDocument().getXDOM()  
19:01 <vmassol> txcontext.setXDOM(xdom)  
19:01 <vmassol> println "{{toc/}}"  
19:01 <vmassol> {{/groovy}}  
19:02 <cdop> ok, thats way too deep for me ;)

19:11 <vmassol> mflorea: here: https://gist.github.com/3853664

19:13 <+mflorea> does it work in a panel?  
19:13 <vmassol> yes  
19:13 <+mflorea> cool  
19:13 <cdop> :-)  
19:14 <vmassol> cdop: you need to star by reading how to cerate a wiki macro: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WikiMacroTutorial  
19:15 <vmassol> or if you wait I can give you the XAR  
19:17 <vmassol> cdop: https://www.dropbox.com/s/b1i7084z4fnttrw/Main.ExtendedTOCMacro.xar  
19:17 <vmassol> then in a panel you write:  
19:18 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/3853698  
19:18 <cdop> wait...  
19:19 <vmassol> so you import this xar in your wiki, this creates a new macro called {{mytoc}}  
19:19 <vmassol> then you can use it  
19:19 <vmassol> as shown on https://gist.github.com/3853698  
19:19 <cdop> ok, how do i import the xar? ;-)  
19:20 <cdop> found it!  
19:20 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/ImportExport  
19:20 <vmassol> I hope your user has PR on your wiki  
19:21 <vmassol> PR = programming rights  
19:21 <cdop> PR? well i use the Admin-Account  
19:22 <cdop> Ok, I added the xar  
19:22 <cdop> and in which panel do i write the velocity-code?  
19:22 <Slashman> has quit  
19:22 <vmassol> you can create a new one  
19:23 <vmassol> call it TOCPanel for ex ;)  
19:23 <vmassol> then add it to the side in the admin  
19:23 <vmassol> to add a new panel go to Panels.WebHome page  
19:24 <cdop> still looking where i can create a panel ;)  
19:25 <cdop> found it  
19:25 <vmassol> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Panels/WebHome  
19:25 <vmassol> to add the panel to the list of isplayed panel go to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Elements  
19:26 <vmassol> panels displayed on the right should be: Panels.Applications,Panels.QuickLinks,Panels.MyRecentModifications  
19:26 <vmassol> just add Panels.TOCPanel  
19:27 <vmassol> got to go swimming… bbl  
19:27 <vmassol> others should be able to help you finish the work  
19:27 <vmassol> it's quite easy  
19:28 <cdop> Ok, got the panel up  
19:28 <cdop> unfortuanlly it says unknown macro mytoc  
19:30 <+mflorea> cdop: edit the macro in object mode and check the visibility property  
19:32 <+mflorea> hmm, I think you just need to save the macro page, Main.ExtendedTOCMacro, so that it gains programming rights to run the groovy script from its content
